DCL Public API: Semaphores - ReadWrite

Send comments on this topic.
This module contains the DCL read/write semaphore abstraction.

Summary

DclSemaphoreRdWrAcquireRead   Acquire a read/write semaphore object for reading.
DclSemaphoreRdWrAcquireWrite   Acquire a read/write semaphore object for writing.
DclSemaphoreRdWrCreate   Create a read/write semaphore object.
DclSemaphoreRdWrDestroy   Destroy a read/write semaphore object that was created with DclSemaphoreRdWrCreate .
DclSemaphoreRdWrRelease   Release a read/write semaphore object.

DclSemaphoreRdWrAcquireRead

D_BOOL DclSemaphoreRdWrAcquireRead( PDCLSEMAPHORERDWR pSemaphore)
Acquire a read/write semaphore object for reading.

Multiple readers can acquire concurrently while no writer has acquired.

Parameters

pSemaphore - a pointer to the semaphore object.

Return Value

Returns TRUE if successful, or FALSE otherwise.

DclSemaphoreRdWrAcquireWrite

D_BOOL DclSemaphoreRdWrAcquireWrite( PDCLSEMAPHORERDWR pSemaphore)
Acquire a read/write semaphore object for writing.

Multiple readers can acquire concurrently while no writer has acquired.

Parameters

pSemaphore - a pointer to the semaphore object.

Return Value

Returns TRUE if successful, or FALSE otherwise.

DclSemaphoreRdWrCreate

PDCLSEMAPHORERDWR DclSemaphoreRdWrCreate(
    const char *pszName,
    D_UINT32 ulCount)
Create a read/write semaphore object.

Parameters

pszName - A pointer to the null terminated semaphore name.
ulCount - The initial semaphore count.

Return Value

Returns a pointer to the semaphore object or NULL if failure.

DclSemaphoreRdWrDestroy

D_BOOL DclSemaphoreRdWrDestroy( PDCLSEMAPHORERDWR pSemaphore)
Destroy a read/write semaphore object that was created with DclSemaphoreRdWrCreate.

Parameters

pSemaphore - A pointer to the semaphore object.

Return Value

Returns TRUE if successful, or FALSE otherwise.

DclSemaphoreRdWrRelease

D_BOOL DclSemaphoreRdWrRelease( PDCLSEMAPHORERDWR pSemaphore)
Release a read/write semaphore object.

Parameters

pSemaphore - A pointer to the semaphore object.

Return Value

Returns TRUE if successful, or FALSE otherwise.
